body:
[@adamjstewart This is in response to a recent thread, but I cannot find it right now]

In developing naming conventions (which is probably a good thing), I think we are placing too much burden on the *name* when trying to determine if a package is duplicate.  I suggest we look at a variety of factors to come to a conclusion that two packages are "possibly duplicate."  Obvious factors to look at would be name and URL.

If we do this, then it will be less important that the name is *exactly* predictable in every. single. case.
title: Detecting Duplicate Packages
